title.rendered: National Unity Day celebrations in Russia

caption.rendered: El presidente de Rusia, Vladímir Putin, intervino en la ceremonia de entrega de premios con motivo del Día de la Unidad Nacional en el Kremlin, Moscú, el 4 de noviembre de 2025. Foto EFE / EPA

image_meta.caption: MOSCOW (Russian Federation), 04/11/2025.- Russian President Vladimir Putin delivers a speech during an award ceremony marking the National Unity Day at the Kremlin in Moscow, Russia, 04 November 2025. The National Unity Day (or Day of People's Unity) is annually celebrated in Russia on 04 November. The Unity Day a national holiday which this year marks the expulsion of Polish occupiers from the Kremlin in 1612. (Rusia, Moscú) EFE/EPA/MAXIM SHIPENKOV
image_meta.title: National Unity Day celebrations in Russia

caption.rendered: Foto: Instagram

title.rendered: Several killed, scores injured in Afghanistan earthquake

caption.rendered: Al menos 20 personas murieron y casi 320 resultaron heridas por el terremoto de magnitud 6,3 que sacudió el norte de Afganistán. Foto EFE

image_meta.caption: SAMANGAN (Afghanistan), 03/11/2025.- A resident inspects the damage left by an earthquake in Samangan, Afghanistan, 3 November 2025. A 6.3-magnitude earthquake struck near Mazar-e-Sharif in northern Afghanistan early on 03 November, killing at least 20 people and injuring hundreds, according to the countrys disaster management authority. The quake hit at a depth of 28 kilometers and damaged homes and the historic Blue Mosque and was felt in Tajikistan, Uzbekistan, and Turkmenistan. Officials fear the death toll could rise as Afghanistan, already hampered by limited disaster response capacity since the Talibans 2021 takeover, faces major recovery challenges. (Terremoto/sismo, Afganistán, Tadjikistan) EFE/EPA/SRT
image_meta.title: Several killed, scores injured in Afghanistan earthquake

title.rendered: Guillermo del Toro presenta en Ciudad de México su película ‘Frankenstein’

caption.rendered: MEX7705. CIUDAD DE MÉXICO (MÉXICO), 03/11/2025.- El actor estadounidense Oscar Isaac (i) y el actor australiano Jacob Elord posan durante la alfombra roja de la película ‘Frankenstein’ este lunes, en Ciudad de México (México). El filme, que se estrena este viernes 7 de noviembre en Netflix, está basada en la célebre novela de Mary Shelley, con el característico estilo cinematográfico del director mexicano que mezcla el terror, la fantasía y una exuberante y personal imaginería visual. EFE/ Mario Guzmán

image_meta.caption: MEX7705. CIUDAD DE MÉXICO (MÉXICO), 03/11/2025.- El actor estadounidense Oscar Isaac (i) y el actor australiano Jacob Elord posan durante la alfombra roja de la película 'Frankenstein' este lunes, en Ciudad de México (México). El filme, que se estrena este viernes 7 de noviembre en Netflix, está basada en la célebre novela de Mary Shelley, con el característico estilo cinematográfico del director mexicano que mezcla el terror, la fantasía y una exuberante y personal imaginería visual. EFE/ Mario Guzmán
image_meta.title: Guillermo del Toro presenta en Ciudad de México su película 'Frankenstein'

title.rendered: Typhoon Kalmaegi crosses central Philippines region

image_meta.caption: CEBU (Philippines), 04/11/2025.- People inspect the damage after the passage of typhoon Kalmaegi in Talisay City, Cebu province, Philippines 04 November 2025. Typhoon Kalmaegi crossed the Visayas region of the central Philippines on 04 November, causing flood, power outage and damage to property. According to the Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical, and Astronomical Services Administration (PAGASA), the storm is projected to be in the vicinity of Patnongon, Antique province, moving northwest at 15kph with maximum winds of 130kph. (tormenta, Filipinas) EFE/EPA/JUANITO ESPINOSA
image_meta.title: Typhoon Kalmaegi crosses central Philippines region

title.rendered: Typhoon Kalmaegi crosses central Philippines region

image_meta.caption: CEBU (Philippines), 04/11/2025.- Damaged vehicles are piled along a flooded street in a residential district affected by typhoon Kalmaegi, in Cebu City, Philippines, 04 November 2025. Typhoon Kalmaegi crossed the Visayas region of central Philippines on 04 November, causing flooding, power outtages and damage to property. According to the Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical, and Astronomical Services Administration (PAGASA), the typhoon is projected to be in the vicinity of Negros Occidental province in the central Philippines, moving west at 25 kilometers per hour with maximum winds of 140 kilometers per hour. (Filipinas) EFE/EPA/JUANITO ESPINOSA
image_meta.title: Typhoon Kalmaegi crosses central Philippines region
